title: Covid Updates: C.D.C. Recommends 2 Covid Vaccines for Very Young Children
summary:
Parents should be able to start getting young children immunized as soon as Tuesday.
Federal regulators now have authorized the Moderna vaccine for children ages 6 months through 5 years, and the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for children ages 6 months through 4 years.
All children 6 months and older, including those who have already been infected with the coronavirus, should get a Covid vaccine, Dr. Rochelle P. Walensky, the C.D.C.’s director, said in a statement.
Both vaccines are safe, and both produced antibody levels similar to those seen in young adults.
